document.docAuthor: MUGRABI, DANIELE F. & AZEVEDO, CELSO O.
document.docTitle: Dissomphalus julius Mugrabi & Azevedo, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Thai Dissomphalus Ashmead, 1893 (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of twenty four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Thai Dissomphalus Ashmead, 1893 (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of twenty four new species

heading.emphasis:
Dissomphalus julius Mugrabi & Azevedo
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. MALE. Body length 1.9 mm . LFW 1.55 mm . Maximum wing width 0.65 mm . Color. Head black; mesosoma dark castaneous; metasoma dark castaneous with castaneous spots.

Head. Mandible with three apical teeth. Clypeus with median lobe trapezoidal; median tooth rounded; median carina complete apically or nearly so, straight in profile or nearly so. Ratio of first four antennal segments about 11:5:3:4. Frons strongly coriaceous, punctures small. LH 1 × WH, WF 0.63 × WH, WF 1.2 × HE, OOL 1.2 × WOT, DAO 0.3 × WOT, posterior ocelli distant from vertex crest 0.67 × DAO, frontal angle of ocellar triangle right, VOL 0.67 × HE. Vertex crest straight. Occipital carina not visible in dorsal view.

Mesosoma. Pronotal disc strongly coriaceous, anterior margin ecarinate. Notauli deep, complete, evenly wide, converging posterad. Propodeal disc 0.71 × as long as wide; basal triangle rugulose, posterolateral area polished; median carina posteriorly incomplete; lateral margins straight, parallel; posterior carina well-defined, straight. Lateral of propodeum mostly weakly coriaceous. Propodeal declivity mostly imbricate.

Metasoma. Tergal process with shallow, subcircular and sublateral pair of depressions; depressions 0.63 × as long as tergite II, parallel, distant each other 1.83 × maximum transverse diameter, with setae short and lateroanterad on lateral area, without pair of tubercles, with laterad tuft of setae ( Figs 48–50 ).

Hypopygium with median stalk 0.93 × as long as hypopygeal plate; median stalk wide; corner of anterior margin angular; lateral stalk of hypopygium 0.27 × as long as median stalk; posterior margin weakly concave with median convexity; corner angalute (Fig. 110).

apex, ventral margin slightly excavated forming a projection with apex angulate in lateral view and subangulate in dorsal view; apical margin strongly concave in ventral view, not curved. Basivolsella setose, with three thick, short and, median setae; with one long spiniform process, basal articulated, with rounded apex. Cuspis biramous. Aedeagus 1.83 × as long as wide; dorsal body of aedeagus wider medially, narrowing progressively apicad, lateral margin strongly convex medially, converging apicad, wholly slightly curved dorsad, apex with one pair of outer lobe; base of dorsal body of aedeagus weakly sclerotized, triangular, with median region angulate; ventral ramus of aedeagus as high as dorsal body, lateral margin sinuous, much wider medially and apex much narrower than base. Apodeme not extending beyond genital ring.

Material examined.
Holotype

Variations. Body length between 1.40 and 3.04 mm ; LFW between 1.29 and 2.05 mm ; maximum wing width between 0.57 and 0.87 mm ; carina of propodeal declivity absent; anterolateral margin of metasomal tergite II without seta; ventral surface of paramere varies between slightly to strongly divided, and apical arm truncate or rounded in lateral view.

Remarks.
Dissomphalus gabrus
sp. nov.
is similar to
D. julius
sp. nov.
because of the following characteristics: mandible with three apical teeth; hypopygium 2.43× as wide as long, apex of median stalk truncate, posterior margin with median evagination; basivolsella with articulated projection; aedeagal dorsal body wider medially, strongly convex medially; aedeagal ventral ramus much wider medially. However,
D. julius
sp. nov.
differs from
D. gabrus
sp. nov.
as follows: depressions of tergal process without tubercles; genital ring sinuous, median region with inclination angle between 45 and 90º; paramere with basal region wider than basiparamere apex, ventral surface divided, apex forming straight angle with inner surface, inner surface without modifications; apex of basivolsella with one short projection; aedeagal ventral ramus as high as dorsal body; apodeme not extending beyond genital ring.

Distribution. Thailand ( Mae Hong Son , Lampang , Chiang Mai , Sakon Nakhon , Phetchabun , Phitsanulok , Sakon Nakhon , Phetchabun , Ubon Ratchathani , Suphanburi , Kanchanaburi , Nakhon Ratchasima , Nakhon Nayok , Chanthaburi and Surat Thani ).
